content.rendered:
The assessment of Campus Climate examines how students, faculty and staff evaluate their experiences in terms of their satisfaction with academic support services, the teaching environment, organizational structure, policies and procedures and the nature of their engagement. The assessment tools used are primarily self-report measures that are locally developed climate surveys  as well as nationally standardized widely used instruments such The National Survey of Student Engagement (NSSE), the UCLA/HERI surveys of CIRP and CSS.

  • Academic Support 1999 (.pdf 71k)
  • Classroom Experiences 1999 (.pdf 89k)
  • Faculty Campus Climate Report, 2005 (.pdf 327k)
  • Student Engagement (NSSE) 2004 (.pdf 78k)
  • University-wide Syllabus Analysis 2002
  • First Year Experience 2006
  • Graduate Student Needs Assessment-Student Life 2006
  • Classified Campus Climate Survey 2009
  • Adjunct Faculty Climate Survey 2010
  • Full-time Faculty Climate Survey 2010
  • Administrative/Professional Climate Survey 2010
  • Non-Returning Student Exit Climate Survey 2010
  • Freshman Orientation Survey 2010
  • Course Evaluation Analysis 2011
  • Data Providers’ Survey 2011
  • Title V Graduate Student Survey 2011

Graduate Student Survey Reports 2011

  • Executive Summary of Findings
  • Report I: Reasons for Choosing La Verne 2011
  • Report II: Program Quality 2011
  • Report III: Satisfaction with Program Climate and Services 2011
  • Report IV: Gains in Competencies 2011
